title: How to start my own advertising agency - Quora

response.answer_text: You'll need a client. A client is someone with a budget, who needs advertising to promote their company/ product/ service and who thinks you can do a better job of it than any of the millions of others out there with a proven track record. So you need to find a way of convincing this client that you are the best, or that you are the one they know and who is available with the necessary knowledge and skills. You convince them by showing them work, case studies, industry awards etc which generate the feeling they are in safe hands. So have you this work, these case studies etc? When Charles and Maurice Saatchi started in the 70’s, there is a story (true or otherwise) that they showed a potential client around their fledgling agency, which was full of busy workers. The client, pleased to see that this start-up was indeed a functioning advertising agency with staff and clients, awarded them their large account. Except all the ‘staff’ were actors, hired by the hour to make the agency seem bustling. I have no way of knowing if this is true, but it wouldn't surprise me. Agencies are often unscrupulous. But to pull something like that off nowadays would be virtually impossible. Stick to being honest, authentic and being what you appear to be.

Sorry it took me longer to answer. My first question would be, are you from advertising industry already? If yes, then its half the battle done. You will just need to formulate a proprietorship or a private limited company. Do the registration, bank account opening and you’re all set. Next would be to get the team. If you’re an advertising professional already, you will know how to go about hiring or let me know I will detail it out for you. Think of a brand-name for yourself. A name that is available across all web and social platforms. Get your website,. Emailers done and lo..you’re ready to go. Get in touch with your clients..present them with what you can do for them. And the rest will follow. However, if you need more hand-holding, I know someone who started her own agency a few years back and is extremely enthusiastic about helping others. Get in touch with her on Linkedin. All the best for your endeavors :)

Starting an advertising agency requires two main components. Originality and creativity. When the presence of these two isn’t in question, kickstarting your agency will be easier. You should be ready to learn at any part of the process. Be it any job or field, learning is a continuous process. Early success is usually never the scenario but once you get the hang of it, being at the top of the industry could be reality. Determine your goal and once its clear you can plot out plans and take courses regarding your planMake sure you have a business plan and decide the capital that could be required for your start upForm a website that showcases your creativity and your ideas. Originality is what makes you, you.Building together a portfolio is important and so is hiring the right employeesDecide which audience you will cater to. Offer deals, attend conferences and learn more with your successes and failures on the wayIn the field of advertising, there are opportunities galore. You new agency might have new exposures and so will you. You need to head towards any situation with a positive mindset and take suggestions as you go. Following that will just ensure you success in the field.

Opening an agency should be just as easy as opening any other business in your area / country. Maybe even easier, because you don’t need any special permission or training. Running the agency is the more difficult part. The way we did it (I now own an ad agency of 40 people in Athens, Greece) is by knowing our craft in one thing and selling this to make a name for ourselves. Our thing was digital, and even though we’ve now done more than 15 TV commercials in the last 12 months, digital is at the heart of everything we propose.

Assuming you know a bit about advertising and your question is about a real agency and not a freelance “I do it all by myself” gig then it goes something like this: An Advertising Agency needs the following Client Service (accounts handling)Creative (the ones with the ideas. Parts of it can be outsourced)Production (the ones producing what the creatives think of. Can be outsourced)Media Buying/Planning (usually this is outsourced to a media buying agency)These are the absolute minimum requirements. So in order to build the Advertising Agency you need someone facing the client and handling the day to day and a creative team. Do your math. See how much it costs to rack up a team, office space, equipment etc. Secure the funds and start looking for clients. If you don’t have revenue after the amount of time you agency burns all its funds close up shop.

To start an advertising business you should be sure if your target and be sure you have a large networking Coz that’s what works in this category and obviously amazing services. The first step should be to get an account for which you should work and service them to next level to make your brand name. Try to gather as many accounts as you can and once you do some excellent work, focus on the PR. You will definitely grow. Slow but long lasting it will be.
